story-overview.user-story: As a product manager, I want comprehensive beta tester onboarding materials, so that beta testers can quickly learn the platform and provide valuable feedback.
story-overview.objective: Create professional onboarding materials for 1-10 SME executive beta testers including welcome email, quick start guide, video walkthrough script, feedback survey, and testing checklist to enable rapid platform adoption and structured feedback collection.
story-overview.success-criteria: - Beta testers can independently navigate platform within 15 minutes of login - All key workflows documented with clear instructions - Feedback collection mechanisms established - Professional presentation suitable for executive audience

criterion.details: - Welcome message and program goals - Login credentials and access instructions - Timeline and expectations (duration, feedback cadence) - Contact information for support
- How to log in and navigate dashboard - How to enroll in a course - How to access content and complete assignments - How to submit assignments and view grades - How to participate in discussions
- Platform tour covering key features - Demonstration of student workflow (enroll → complete assignment → view grade) - Q&A contact information

criterion.description: Feedback Survey prepared (Google Forms or Typeform)
criterion.details: - Satisfaction rating (1-5 scale) - Feature usability questions - Bug reporting section - Open-ended feedback

criterion.description: Beta Testing Checklist created (key workflows to test)
criterion.details: - Enroll in course - View content (all content types) - Submit assignment (text + file) - View grades and feedback - Post in discussion forum - Report any issues encountered

criterion.description: All materials reviewed and approved by stakeholder

technical-context.target-audience: Senior executives evaluating AI Gurus bundled offering

key-platform-features.feature: - NextAuth database sessions - 30-day session duration, 7-day idle timeout - Password reset capability
- Browse course catalog - View course prerequisites, learning objectives, target audience - Self-enrollment with prerequisite confirmation - Enrollment confirmation
- Tabbed interface: Overview, Content, Assignments, Discussions, Announcements - Dashboard with quick stats (content items, assignments, announcements) - Breadcrumb navigation
- Multiple content types: TEXT, VIDEO, DOCUMENT, LINK, SCORM, YOUTUBE - Embedded YouTube videos with player - File downloads for documents and videos - External link access
- Text response submission - File attachment upload (PDF, DOCX, images - max 50MB) - Submission confirmation - View submission status
- Access gradebook from main navigation - View assignment grades with instructor feedback - Course GPA calculation (4.0 scale) - Overall GPA across all courses
- Create new discussion posts - Reply to existing threads - View nested replies - Instructor and peer interaction
- View course announcements - Chronological display with author and date - Read full announcement content

user-roles.role: Primary beta tester role for AI Fluency Program
Content creator and grader (may be involved in beta)

journey.name: Discovery & Enrollment
journey.step: Logs in → Views course catalog at /courses
Reviews AI Fluency Program details (description, syllabus, duration)
Reviews prerequisites, learning objectives, and target audience → Confirms course fit
Decision Point: Self-enroll or request instructor enrollment?

journey.name: Course Navigation & Content Consumption
journey.step: Accesses course dashboard → Views content modules
Decision Point: Need clarification? → Posts discussion question
Completes module → Moves to next section

journey.name: Assignment Submission
journey.step: Views assignment details (due date, requirements, rubric)
Decision Point: Text response only or file attachment needed?
Edge Case: Late submission → System allows with timestamp

journey.name: Feedback & Progress Tracking
journey.step: Receives grade notification → Views instructor feedback
Checks gradebook → Monitors GPA and progress
Decision Point: Disagree with grade? → Contacts instructor via discussion
Completes course → Views final GPA and achievement

quick-start-guide-outline.section: - Thank you message for participation - Beta program purpose and goals - What to expect during beta

section.name: Getting Started
section.subsection: - Navigate to: https://learn.aigurus.com - Enter credentials (provided in welcome email) - First-time login: Password change prompt (optional but recommended)
- Course catalog: Browse available courses - My Courses: View enrolled courses - Navigation: Main menu structure - Profile: Manage account settings

section.name: Course Enrollment
section.subsection: - Click "Courses" in main navigation - View course cards with title, code, instructor - Search functionality for filtering courses
- Click course card to view details - Review description, prerequisites, learning objectives - Check target audience to ensure course fit - View instructor information and enrolled student count

- Prerequisites: If present, review and confirm you meet them - Check prerequisite confirmation checkbox - Click "Enroll Now" button - Confirmation message appears - Course moves from "Available Courses" to "My Enrolled Courses"

section.name: Accessing Course Content
section.subsection: - Overview: Course description, quick stats, upcoming assignments - Content: All course materials (videos, readings, resources) - Assignments: View and submit assignments - Discussions: Participate in course discussions - Announcements: View course announcements
- Click "Content" tab - Content displayed with icons (video, document, link) - Embedded YouTube videos play inline - Documents and files available for download - External links open in new tab

section.name: Assignment Submission
section.subsection: - Navigate to "Assignments" tab - Click assignment to view details - Review assignment description, due date, max points - Enter text response in submission textarea - Click "Submit" button

- Click "Choose File" or file upload button - Select file from computer (PDF, DOCX, images supported) - Max file size: 50MB - Verify file appears in submission - Click "Submit" button - Submission confirmation displayed

section.name: Viewing Grades & Feedback
section.subsection: - Click "Gradebook" in main navigation (if available) - OR view grades within course assignment page - View all assignment grades - See course GPA (4.0 scale)
- Click grade to view detailed feedback - Read instructor comments - Review points earned vs. max points
- Course GPA: Weighted average of all assignments in course - Overall GPA: Average across all enrolled courses - 4.0 scale (A = 4.0, B = 3.0, C = 2.0, D = 1.0, F = 0.0)

section.name: Discussion Participation
section.subsection: - Navigate to "Discussions" tab in course - Click "New Post" or "Create Discussion" button - Enter title and content - Click "Post" button - Post appears in discussion list
- Click discussion post to view thread - Scroll to reply section - Enter your response - Click "Reply" button - Reply appears in nested thread

section.name: Troubleshooting
section.subsection: - Can't login: Verify credentials, try password reset - File upload fails: Check file size (max 50MB), verify file type - Content not loading: Refresh page, check internet connection - Video not playing: Check browser compatibility (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge)
- Email support: [support@aigurus.com or beta contact email] - Response time: Within 24 hours (business days) - For urgent issues: [phone or emergency contact if provided]

quick-start-guide-outline.section: - Your feedback is invaluable - Complete feedback survey: [survey URL] - Report bugs immediately: [bug reporting process] - Share suggestions and ideas - Thank you for helping improve AI Gurus LMS

welcome-email-template.subject: Welcome to AI Gurus LMS Beta Program!
welcome-email-template.body:
Dear [Beta Tester Name],
Welcome to the AI Gurus LMS beta program! We're excited to have you as one of our first users.
**Program Goals:** - Validate core learning workflows (enrollment, content access, assignments, grading) - Gather feedback on user experience and feature usability - Identify bugs and improvement opportunities before public launch
**Your Access:** - Platform URL: https://learn.aigurus.com - Username: [provided individually] - Temporary Password: [provided individually] - Please change your password upon first login for security
**Timeline & Expectations:** - Beta Duration: [X weeks/months] - Testing Checklist: Complete key workflows (see attached) - Feedback Survey: Please complete after initial testing - Feedback Cadence: Weekly check-ins via email
**Getting Started:** 1. Watch the video walkthrough (5-10 minutes): [video URL] 2. Review the Quick Start Guide: [guide URL or attached] 3. Complete the Beta Testing Checklist: [checklist URL or attached] 4. Submit feedback via survey: [survey URL]
**Support:** - Email: [support email address] - Response Time: Within 24 hours (business days)
**Important:** This is a beta environment. While we've tested extensively, you may encounter bugs. Please report any issues immediately—your feedback directly shapes the final product!
Thank you for your participation and valuable insights. We look forward to hearing your feedback.
Best regards, [Product Manager Name] AI Gurus Team

video-walkthrough-script.segment: - Welcome to AI Gurus LMS - Purpose of beta program - What we'll cover in this walkthrough (6 key workflows)
- Navigate to learn.aigurus.com - Login with provided credentials - Overview of dashboard: My Courses, Course Catalog, Navigation - Show search functionality

- Browse course catalog - Click on a course to view details - Review prerequisites, learning objectives, target audience - Demonstrate prerequisite confirmation - Click "Enroll Now" button - Show enrollment confirmation

- Access enrolled course - Navigate through tabs: Overview, Content, Assignments, Discussions - View course content (show different content types) - Demonstrate embedded YouTube video - Navigate to assignment - Show assignment details (due date, max points, description) - Submit assignment with text response - Demonstrate file upload - Show submission confirmation

- Access gradebook (show how to navigate there) - View assignment grades - Click to see instructor feedback - Show course GPA calculation - Navigate to discussions - Demonstrate creating a new discussion post - Show how to reply to existing thread
- How to navigate efficiently using tabs - Where to find help (support contact) - Common workflows summary - Keyboard shortcuts (if any)

- Importance of your feedback for product improvement - How to access feedback survey - How to report bugs (include in survey or separate email) - Contact information for questions - Thank you message - Encourage exploration and feedback
video-walkthrough-script.production-notes: - Screen recording: Use Loom, OBS, or QuickTime - Narration: Clear, professional, friendly tone - Cursor highlighting: Enable for visibility - Editing: Trim pauses, add captions if needed - Upload: YouTube (unlisted) or Vimeo for easy sharing - Thumbnail: Create engaging thumbnail with AI Gurus branding

workflow.name: Enroll in Course
workflow.step: Search for "AI Fluency" or browse available courses
Click course card to view details
Check course appears in "My Enrolled Courses"
workflow.acceptance: Course enrollment successful, course visible in dashboard

workflow.name: View Content (All Content Types)
workflow.step: Test TEXT content: Read text content displayed inline
Test VIDEO content: Click download link or view video
Test YOUTUBE content: Watch embedded video, test fullscreen
Test DOCUMENT content: Download PDF or DOCX file
Test LINK content: Click external link, opens in new tab
Test SCORM content: Access interactive content (if available)
workflow.acceptance: All content types display correctly, media plays, downloads work

workflow.name: Submit Assignment (Text + File)
workflow.step: Review assignment description, due date, max points
Enter text response in submission textarea (minimum 50 words)
Select test file (PDF or DOCX, under 50MB)
Verify file name appears after selection

workflow.name: View Grades and Feedback
workflow.step: Wait for instructor to grade submission (coordinate timing)
Navigate to gradebook or assignment page
Review points earned vs. max points
Verify overall GPA (if enrolled in multiple courses)
workflow.acceptance: Grades visible, feedback readable, GPA calculated correctly

workflow.name: Post in Discussion Forum
workflow.step: Verify post appears in discussion list
Enter reply text in reply field
workflow.acceptance: Discussion post created, reply posted, nested display correct

workflow.name: Report Any Issues Encountered
workflow.step: Take screenshots of errors or unexpected behavior
Note what you were doing when issue occurred
Document steps to reproduce the issue
Rate severity: Critical, Major, or Minor
Include in feedback survey or email directly to support
workflow.acceptance: Issues documented with sufficient detail for team to investigate

optional-exploratory-testing.suggestion: Test edge cases: very long text, special characters, large files (near 50MB)
Test mobile responsiveness: access platform on phone/tablet
Test browser compatibility: try Chrome, Firefox, Safari
Test navigation: use breadcrumbs, back button, direct URLs
Test accessibility: try keyboard navigation (Tab, Enter, Escape)

notes.note: Beta testers are SME executives - materials must be professional, concise, and respectful of their time. Avoid technical jargon, focus on business value and user experience.
This story is documentation and content creation - no code changes required. All materials should reference existing production features from Epics 1-3.
Complete before Story 4.7 (Production Launch) to allow stakeholder review and approval. Video recording may take longest - prioritize script creation early.
Ensure support contact information is finalized before distributing materials. Coordinate with stakeholder on response time commitments.
